question.title: Count Positive-Negative Pairs
question.content:
You have been given an array/list(ARR) of positive and negative integers. Print the number of pairs where:

arr[i] = -arr[j] and i != j
Note:
Given array/list can contain duplicate elements and will not contain '0'.

(arr[i],arr[j]) and (arr[j],arr[i]) are considered same.
Input format :
The first line of each test case contains an integers 'N' where 'N' denotes the size of array/list(ARR).

The next line contains 'N' space-separated integers representing array elements.
Output format :
Print the total number of positive-negative pairs present in the array/list.
Note:
You are not required to print the output explicitly, it has already been taken care of. Just implement the function.
Constraints :
1 <= N <= 10^5
-10^9 <= arr[i] <= 10^9

Time Limit: 1 sec
Sample Input 1:
9
-1 3 6 2 5 -4 3 2 -4
Sample Output 1:
0
 Explanation For Sample Input 1:
Since there doesn't exist any positive-negative pair, the Output is '0'.
Sample Input 2:
6
-2 8 2 5 -2 -5
Sample Output 2:
3

rephrased.body: Given an array/list of positive and negative integers, find the number of pairs where `arr[i] = -arr[j]` and `i != j`. Note that the array/list can contain duplicate elements and will not contain '0'. Also, `(arr[i], arr[j])` and `(arr[j], arr[i])` are considered the same pair.

testcases.explanation: There are no positive-negative pairs in the input array.
The pairs are (-2, 2), (-2,2) and (-5, 5). There are two occurances of -2 and 2 so we form 2 pairs from that and 1 pair from -5, 5

hints: Try to explore every possible pair and check for the required condition.
Can you think of a solution if you sort the array? You can also observe that sum of the two elements is 0 when they make a positive-negative pair.
Try to think of a data structure which can store the count of occurrence of elements. If you know this can you optimize your solution to O(N)?
